messages.content: are there alternatives for PVsyst that i can use to model sun angles and output?

Yes, there are several alternatives to **PVsyst** for modeling **sun angles**, **solar irradiance**, and **PV system output**. Depending on your goals (e.g., educational use, quick feasibility checks, or detailed engineering simulations), the best tool will vary. Here's a breakdown:

---

## ðŸ§° **Popular PV Modeling Tools (Alternatives to PVsyst)**

### 1. **SAM (System Advisor Model) â€“ NREL**
- **Platform:** Windows, macOS
- **Cost:** Free
- **Use Case:** Detailed PV system modeling with financial analysis.
- **Pros:**
  - Backed by NREL.
  - Includes irradiance, shading, weather data, and battery/storage models.
  - GUI and Python SDK (for scripting).
- **Cons:** Slightly steeper learning curve.

ðŸ‘‰ [https://sam.nrel.gov/](https://sam.nrel.gov/)

---

### 2. **HelioScope (by Aurora Solar)**
- **Platform:** Web-based
- **Cost:** Paid (trial available)
- **Use Case:** Commercial-scale PV design with easy layout tools.
- **Pros:**
  - Easy to use, 3D shading analysis.
  - Integrates layout, shading, and performance modeling.
- **Cons:** Cloud-based, not fully free.

ðŸ‘‰ [https://www.helioscope.com/](https://www.helioscope.com/)

---

### 3. **HOMER Grid (NREL)**
- **Platform:** Desktop
- **Cost:** Paid (free trial)
- **Use Case:** Hybrid energy systems (PV + diesel + storage + grid).
- **Pros:** Great for microgrids and energy optimization.
- **Cons:** Less focused on solar-only systems.

ðŸ‘‰ [https://www.homerenergy.com/products/grid/index.html](https://www.homerenergy.com/products/grid/index.html)

---

### 4. **pvlib (Python Library)**
- **Platform:** Python
- **Cost:** Free, open-source
- **Use Case:** Custom solar calculations, scripting
- **Pros:**
  - Extremely flexible.
  - Models solar position, irradiance, losses, etc.
- **Cons:** Requires Python coding experience.

ðŸ‘‰ [https://pvlib-python.readthedocs.io/](https://pvlib-python.readthedocs.io/)

---

### 5. **Grasshopper + Ladybug Tools (Rhino Plugin)**
- **Platform:** Rhino 3D / Grasshopper
- **Cost:** Free (requires Rhino)
- **Use Case:** Architectural solar simulation, including sun paths, radiation maps.
- **Pros:** Great for visual analysis.
- **Cons:** Less focused on electrical output; more useful for building design and urban planning.

ðŸ‘‰ [https://www.ladybug.tools/](https://www.ladybug.tools/)

---

### 6. **Archeliosâ„¢ Pro (Trace Software)**
- **Platform:** Web/Desktop
- **Cost:** Paid (trial available)
- **Use Case:** Feasibility and bankability studies.
- **Pros:** Built for professional PV project developers.
- **Cons:** Similar to PVsyst in complexity and pricing.

ðŸ‘‰ [https://www.trace-software.com/archelios-suite/](https://www.trace-software.com/archelios-suite/)

---

### 7. **SketchUp + Skelion Plugin**
- **Platform:** SketchUp
- **Cost:** Free/Paid
- **Use Case:** Visual PV layout and sun analysis.
- **Pros:** Good for simple architectural site design.
- **Cons:** Output accuracy may not match PVsyst/SAM.

---
